MS MCQs

    Send reminders to customers in Dynamics 365 Business Central

    »

    1. Which one of the following statements about reminders is true?

      A reminder term in Business Central always has three levels.

      You can charge interest to a customer by using reminders.

      You can only create each reminder level once.

      Additional fees are always posted to the general ledger.


    2. What can you use the Update Reminder Text function for?

      To change the beginning and ending text on the reminder.

      To recalculate text variables.

      To translate the beginning and ending text to the language that you choose when you are running the functions.

      To update the beginning and ending text on the reminder. If you use text variables, they are recalculated.


    3. When you are running the Create Reminders batch job, which one of the following options can you use to make sure that none of the open customer ledger entries, that are on hold and are not due for payment, will be shown on reminders?

      Include Entries On Hold

      Use Header Level

      Only Entries with Overdue Amount

      None – All open entries that are not on hold, even if the entries are not due for payment yet, will be shown on reminders.
